page.title: 18THE KNOTTINGLEY-GOOLE CANAL
page.content: A canal runs through Knottingley.The canal was built in the early 19th century to carry{coal}from the Yorkshire coalfield for export. The canal is still a busy commercial waterway and coal is still the main cargo,but coal is no longer exported, it is now taken from the pits,to coal burning{power stations}.A special type of barge is used to transport the coal, called a{Ferrybridge Compartment {Boat}, each holding 170 tons; up to{5 can be{pushed}at once,in all 850 tons. Another cargo is{oil}and{petrol brought from the refinery at Immingham to the depot at Leeds. {Sand}which is used to make{glass},is still brought to Rockware glass works by canal.The canal is being used more for{leisure},by pleasure boats ,with also a canalside walk and picnic area.
